description: [Daily News] Speaking on World Food Day, Wawira Njiru, CEO of Kenyan non-profit Food for Education, has called on African and world leaders to invest in school feeding programs to feed the future of all of Africa.
title: Africa: Africa Must Invest in School Feeding Programs to Boost Its Future

description: [Ghanaian Times] The Head, Education Division, African Union Commission, Ms Sophia Ashipala, has urged African leaders to fashion out measures that address the challenge of skills mismatch on the continent.
title: Africa: Fashion Out Measures to Address Skills Mismatch Challenges On Continent ...AU Commissioner Appeals to African Leaders

description: [ISS] Disputes over the Grand Ethiopian Renaissance Dam intersect with conflicts sparked by Ethiopia's Red Sea ambitions.
title: Africa: Nile River Basin Commission - Regional Strife Could Make a Difficult Task Impossible

description: [The Conversation Africa] US president Joe Biden chose to visit Africa in the final weeks of his presidency. It would be his first trip to the continent since taking office in January 2021.
title: Africa: Joe Biden in Africa - U.S. President Has Ignored the Continent for His Entire Term - Why He's Visiting Angola

description: [Business Day Africa] When accountancy CEO, Hakainde Hichilema, was finally elected President of Zambia (on his sixth attempt) in 2021, international observers breathed a sigh of relief. Here was a man with a reputation for business probity to tackle the deep problems of the near-bankrupt African country that defaulted on its foreign debt in 2020.
title: Africa: West's Favourite African Leader Faces Rule of Law Crisis At Home

description: [allAfrica] Rwanda has had 62 cases and 15 deaths from its Marburg outbreak since its declaration three weeks ago, Dr. Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, WHO Director-General, said during a media briefing.
title: Africa: Rwanda's Marburg Outbreak Claims 15 Lives

description: [IPS] United Nations -- The growing gender gap between men and women is reflected not only in the world's highest political hierarchies but also in the daily social and economic lives--with most women fighting a losing battle against poverty.
title: Africa: A Staggering 2.0 Billion Women Live in Poverty With No Access to Social Protection

description: [Daily News] DEPUTY Prime Minister and Minister for Energy, Dr Doto Biteko on Wednesday assured that Tanzania is fully committed to supporting realisation of universal electricity access in Africa by 2030.
title: Africa: Tanzania Commits to Universal Electricity Access in Africa By 2030

description: [AI London] Ahead of the COP16 Biodiversity summit, which runs from 21 October to 1 November in Cali, Colombia, Amnesty International's Secretary General, Agnès Callamard, said:
title: Africa: COP16 - States Must Reinforce Human Rights Protections in Global Biodiversity Framework

description: [New Times] World Health Organization (WHO) Regional Director for Africa Dr Matshidiso Moeti on Wednesday, October 16, visited Marburg outbreak response sites in Kigali and thanked Rwandan health workers and survivors for their work and bravery.
title: Africa: WHO Africa Chief Lauds Rwanda's 'Swift' Response to Marburg Outbreak

description: [Africa Renewal] Wawira Njiru says school feeding is essential for strengthening human capital and developing the future workforce.
title: Africa: Meals for Schoolchildren - How to Combat Child Hunger in Africa
